snippet: The White House sought to dispel growing confusion over exactly what role American soldiers are going to play on the battlefield in the unfolding operation.
abstract: Pres Obama addresses soldiers at MacDill Air Force Base in Tampa, Fla, vowing that American troops will not be sent into combat against Islamic militants in Iraq.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Tampa, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington. Mark Landler and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington, and David E. Sanger from New York.

lead_paragraph: The White House sought to dispel growing confusion over exactly what role American soldiers are going to play on the battlefield in the unfolding operation.

headline.main: Obama Promises Again Not to Send Ground Troops to Fight Militants
headline.print_headline: Obama Promises Again Not to Send Ground Troops to Fight Militants
